intro: Peristylus chorisianus, commonly known as the mountain hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. It produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind.
